snippet: In his first comments since Israel warned the United States about negotiating with Tehran, Secretary of State John Kerry expressed wariness over such talks.
abstract: Sec of State John Kerry, in his first remarks about Iran since Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel warned United States to be wary of talks with the country, says that the United States will negotiate with Tehran only if it provides proof that it will not pursue nuclear defense programs.
lead_paragraph: In his first comments since Israel warned the United States about negotiating with Tehran, Secretary of State John Kerry expressed wariness over such talks.

headline.main: Kerry Says Talks With Iran Will Not Be Based on Trust
headline.print_headline: Kerry Says Iran Must Earn Trust of U.S.
